alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Fairfield; Fayette; Franklin; Licking; Madison; Pickaway; Ross; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 4:46PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN, WESTERN FAIRFIELD, NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE, PICKAWAY, DELAWARE, WESTERN LICKING, EASTERN MADISON, SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO AND NORTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO THROUGH 515 PM EST... At 445 PM EST, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Delaware to near Washington Court House, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. Observed wind gust of 44 mph was recently reported at London Madison County Airport. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Lancaster, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Delaware, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Marysville, Pickerington, Washington Court House, Worthington, Circleville, Bexley, London, Jefferson, Pataskala and Powell. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 78 and 121. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 71 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
